message_1: In a class of 30 students, 18 take music lessons and 14 take art lessons. If 8 students take both music and art lessons, how many students do not take any of these lessons?
message_2:
To find out how many students do not take any of these lessons, we can use the principle of inclusion-exclusion.

Total students taking music or art lessons = Students taking music lessons + Students taking art lessons - Students taking both music and art lessons

Total students taking music or art lessons = 18 (music) + 14 (art) - 8 (both)

Total students taking music or art lessons = 24

Now, to find out how many students do not take any of these lessons, we can subtract the total students taking music or art lessons from the total number of students in the class.

Students not taking any lessons = Total students - Total students taking music or art lessons

Students not taking any lessons = 30 - 24

Students not taking any lessons = 6

So, 6 students do not take any of these lessons.
